snippet: The sales increase, after a slowing in September and October, was being closely watched as an indication of the recovery’s staying power.
abstract: Industrywide auto sales rose 8.9 percent in November, to 1.25 million vehicles; automakers predict seasonally adjusted annual rate of 16.3 million vehicles sold, highest since May 2007.
lead_paragraph: The sales increase, after a slowing in September and October, was being closely watched as an indication of the recovery’s staying power.

headline.main: Out of the Doldrums, Automakers Post Strong U.S. Sales
headline.print_headline: Out of the Doldrums, Automakers Post Strong U.S. Sales
